revised_title: Toxicity and Effects of Laurel Water on Dogs
tldr: The author conducted experiments to study the poisonous effects of distilled laurel water on dogs. They found that the water caused convulsions, vomiting, and difficulty breathing in the dogs, leading to their death. The author also observed differences in the effects of the laurel water on different dogs, suggesting varying levels of toxicity. The study provides insights into the potential dangers of laurel tree consumption and the importance of understanding plant poisoning in animals.
